intro: Adnaria virgata, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and feathery leaves, which are often used in herbal medicine. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in coastal areas and saline soils. Its root system is adapted to withstand saltwater and tidal fluctuations. Adnaria virgata is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and landscapes.
